text:
Duncans m(J.1s, p&lif,
August 4,
Dear Graydon:
I believe the last time we met was
in a Minneapolis hotel room over a whiff of
bourbon (yours). Sometime during this year
I trust we will have a chance to renew the
acquaintance.
Meantime, I want to send this note to
thank you for your telegram of yesterday,
and for your pronpt action in setting the
Rockefeller project in motion. I have
made contact with Frank Schooley, and I
believe we are underway without complica¬
tions. The project will be an interesting
experiment, and if we get somewhere with
it in these six months — as I think we may
fairly hope — it should lead to greater
things.
Sincere regards,
Mr. Graydon Ausmus
National Association of Educational
Broadcasters
Box 2002
University, Alabama
